intro: Erigeron blasdalei, commonly known as the Blasdale's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. It features narrow, blue-green leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
